methods.allowsReinterpret:
Test if a reinterpret call will succeed.

Note: Java generics information - <ALTERNATE_DATA_TYPE>

:param alternateDataType: (java.lang.Class<ALTERNATE_DATA_TYPE>) - The alternative type to consider
:return: (boolean) If a reinterpret on this column source with the supplied alternateDataType will succeed.
methods.ensureCapacity:
Ensure that this WritableColumnSource can accept row keys in range [0, capacity).

:param capacity: (long) - The new minimum capacity
:param nullFill: (boolean) - Whether data should be "null-filled". If true, get operations at row keys that have not been
        set will return the appropriate null value; otherwise such gets produce undefined results.
methods.exposesChunkedBackingStore:
Does this column source provide a chunked exposed backing store?

:return: (boolean) true if this column source provides a chunked backing store, false otherwise
methods.fillChunk:
Populates the given destination chunk with data corresponding to the keys from the given RowSequence.

:param context: (io.deephaven.engine.table.ChunkSource.FillContext) - A context containing all mutable/state related data used in retrieving the Chunk.
:param destination: (io.deephaven.chunk.WritableChunk<? superio.deephaven.chunk.attributes.Values>) - The chunk to be populated according to rowSequence. No assumptions shall be made about
        the size of the chunk shall be made. The chunk will be populated from position [0,rowSequence.size()).
:param rowSequence: (io.deephaven.engine.rowset.RowSequence) - An RowSequence representing the keys to be fetched
methods.fillFromChunk:
Our default, inefficient, implementation. Inheritors who care should provide a better implementation.

:param context: (io.deephaven.engine.table.ChunkSink.FillFromContext) - A context containing all mutable/state related data used in writing the Chunk.
:param src: (io.deephaven.chunk.Chunk<? extendsio.deephaven.chunk.attributes.Values>) - The source of the data rowSequence
:param rowSequence: (io.deephaven.engine.rowset.RowSequence) - An RowSequence representing the keys to be written
methods.fillFromChunkUnordered:
Fills the ChunkSink with data from the source, with data corresponding to the keys from the given key chunk.

:param context: (io.deephaven.engine.table.ChunkSink.FillFromContext) - A context containing all mutable/state related data used in writing the Chunk.
:param src: (io.deephaven.chunk.Chunk<? extendsio.deephaven.chunk.attributes.Values>) - The source of the data RowSequence
:param keys: (io.deephaven.chunk.LongChunk<io.deephaven.engine.rowset.chunkattributes.RowKeys>) - A LongChunk representing the keys to be written
methods.fillPrevChunk:
Populates the given destination chunk with data corresponding to the keys from the given RowSequence.

:param context: (io.deephaven.engine.table.ChunkSource.FillContext) - A context containing all mutable/state related data used in retrieving the Chunk.
:param destination: (io.deephaven.chunk.WritableChunk<? superio.deephaven.chunk.attributes.Values>) - The chunk to be populated according to rowSequence. No assumptions shall be made
        about the size of the chunk shall be made. The chunk will be populated from position
        [0,rowSequence.size()).
:param rowSequence: (io.deephaven.engine.rowset.RowSequence) - An RowSequence representing the keys to be fetched
methods.getAndSetUnsafe:
*Overload 1*  
  :param index: long
  :param newValue: java.lang.Boolean
  :return: java.lang.Boolean
  
*Overload 2*  
  :param index: long

  :return: byte
methods.getCapacity:
Get the capacity of this column source. This number is one higher than the highest key that may be accessed (read
 or written).

:return: (long) The capacity of this column source
methods.getChunk:
Returns a chunk of data corresponding to the keys from the given RowSequence.

:param context: (io.deephaven.engine.table.ChunkSource.GetContext) - A context containing all mutable/state related data used in retrieving the Chunk. In particular,
        the Context may be used to provide a Chunk data pool
:param rowSequence: (io.deephaven.engine.rowset.RowSequence) - An RowSequence representing the keys to be fetched
:return: (io.deephaven.chunk.Chunk<io.deephaven.chunk.attributes.Values>) A chunk of data corresponding to the keys from the given RowSequence
methods.getPrevChunk:
Returns a chunk of previous data corresponding to the keys from the given RowSequence.

:param context: (io.deephaven.engine.table.ChunkSource.GetContext) - A context containing all mutable/state related data used in retrieving the Chunk. In
        particular, the Context may be used to provide a Chunk data pool
:param rowSequence: (io.deephaven.engine.rowset.RowSequence) - An RowSequence representing the keys to be fetched
:return: (io.deephaven.chunk.Chunk<io.deephaven.chunk.attributes.Values>) A chunk of data corresponding to the keys from the given RowSequence
methods.makeFillContext:
Allocate a new ChunkSource.FillContext for filling chunks from this FillContextMaker, typically a
 ChunkSource.

:param chunkCapacity: (int) - The maximum size of any WritableChunk that will be filled with this context
:param sharedContext: (io.deephaven.engine.table.SharedContext) - Shared store of intermediate results.
:return: (io.deephaven.engine.table.impl.sources.ArraySourceHelper.FillContext) A context for use with fill operations
methods.makeFillFromContext:
Provide a default, empty ChunkSink.FillFromContext for use with our default
 WritableColumnSource.fillFromChunk(io.deephaven.engine.table.ChunkSink.FillFromContext, io.deephaven.chunk.Chunk<? extends io.deephaven.chunk.attributes.Values>, io.deephaven.engine.rowset.RowSequence).

:param chunkCapacity: int
:return: io.deephaven.engine.table.ChunkSink.FillFromContext
methods.resetWritableChunkToBackingStore:
Resets the given chunk to provide a write-through reference to our backing array.
 
 Note: This is unsafe to use if previous tracking has been enabled!

:param chunk: (io.deephaven.chunk.ResettableWritableChunk<?>) - the writable chunk to reset to our backing array.
:param position: (long) - position that we require
:return: (long) the first position addressable by the chunk
methods.resetWritableChunkToBackingStoreSlice:
Resets the given chunk to provide a write-through reference to our backing array.
 
 Note: This is unsafe to use if previous tracking has been enabled!

:param chunk: (io.deephaven.chunk.ResettableWritableChunk<?>) - the writable chunk to reset to a slice of our backing array.
:param position: (long) - position of the first value in the returned chunk
:return: (long) the capacity of the returned chunk

methods.startTrackingPrevValues: Force my inheritors to implement this method, rather than taking the interface default.

text: TODO: Re-implement this with better compression (only need 2 bits per value, or we can pack 5 values into 1 byte if we're feeling fancy).
